69struct evconnlistener_ops {
70 int (*enable)(struct evconnlistener *);
71 int (*disable)(struct evconnlistener *);
72 void (*destroy)(struct evconnlistener *);
73 void (*shutdown)(struct evconnlistener *);
74 evutil_socket_t (*getfd)(struct evconnlistener *);
75 struct event_base *(*getbase)(struct evconnlistener *);
76};
77
78struct evconnlistener {
79 const struct evconnlistener_ops *ops;
80 void *lock;
81 evconnlistener_cb cb;
82 evconnlistener_errorcb errorcb;
83 void *user_data;
84 unsigned flags;
85 short refcnt;
86 int accept4_flags;
87 unsigned enabled : 1;
88};
89
90struct evconnlistener_event {
91 struct evconnlistener base;
92 struct event listener;
93};
94
95#ifdef _WIN32
96struct evconnlistener_iocp {
97 struct evconnlistener base;
98 evutil_socket_t fd;
99 struct event_base *event_base;
100 struct event_iocp_port *port;
101 short n_accepting;
102 unsigned shutting_down : 1;
103 unsigned event_added : 1;
104 struct accepting_socket **accepting;
105};
106#endif
107
108#define LOCK(listener) EVLOCK_LOCK((listener)->lock, 0)
109#define UNLOCK(listener) EVLOCK_UNLOCK((listener)->lock, 0)
110
111struct evconnlistener *
112evconnlistener_new_async(struct event_base *base,
113 evconnlistener_cb cb, void *ptr, unsigned flags, int backlog,
114 evutil_socket_t fd); /* XXXX export this? */
115
116static int event_listener_enable(struct evconnlistener *);
117static int event_listener_disable(struct evconnlistener *);
118static void event_listener_destroy(struct evconnlistener *);
119static evutil_socket_t event_listener_getfd(struct evconnlistener *);
120static struct event_base *event_listener_getbase(struct evconnlistener *);
121
122#if 0
123static void
124listener_incref_and_lock(struct evconnlistener *listener)
125{
126 LOCK(listener);
127 ++listener->refcnt;
128}
129#endif
130
131static int
132listener_decref_and_unlock(struct evconnlistener *listener)
133{
134 int refcnt = --listener->refcnt;
135 if (refcnt == 0) {
136 listener->ops->destroy(listener);
137 UNLOCK(listener);
138 EVTHREAD_FREE_LOCK(listener->lock, EVTHREAD_LOCKTYPE_RECURSIVE);
139 mm_free(listener);
140 return 1;
141 } else {
142 UNLOCK(listener);
143 return 0;
144 }
145}
146
147static const struct evconnlistener_ops evconnlistener_event_ops = {
148 event_listener_enable,
149 event_listener_disable,
150 event_listener_destroy,
151 NULL, /* shutdown */
152 event_listener_getfd,
153 event_listener_getbase
154};
155
156static void listener_read_cb(evutil_socket_t, short, void *);
157
158struct evconnlistener *
159evconnlistener_new(struct event_base *base,
160 evconnlistener_cb cb, void *ptr, unsigned flags, int backlog,
161 evutil_socket_t fd)
162{
163 struct evconnlistener_event *lev;
164
165#ifdef _WIN32
166 if (base && event_base_get_iocp_(base)) {
167 const struct win32_extension_fns *ext =
168 event_get_win32_extension_fns_();
169 if (ext->AcceptEx && ext->GetAcceptExSockaddrs)
170 return evconnlistener_new_async(base, cb, ptr, flags,
171 backlog, fd);
172 }
173#endif
174
175 if (backlog > 0) {
176 if (listen(fd, backlog) < 0)
177 return NULL;
178 } else if (backlog < 0) {
179 if (listen(fd, 128) < 0)
180 return NULL;
181 }
182
183 lev = mm_calloc(1, sizeof(struct evconnlistener_event));
184 if (!lev)
185 return NULL;
186
187 lev->base.ops = &evconnlistener_event_ops;
188 lev->base.cb = cb;
189 lev->base.user_data = ptr;
190 lev->base.flags = flags;
191 lev->base.refcnt = 1;
192
193 lev->base.accept4_flags = 0;
194 if (!(flags & LEV_OPT_LEAVE_SOCKETS_BLOCKING))
195 lev->base.accept4_flags |= EVUTIL_SOCK_NONBLOCK;
196 if (flags & LEV_OPT_CLOSE_ON_EXEC)
197 lev->base.accept4_flags |= EVUTIL_SOCK_CLOEXEC;
198
199 if (flags & LEV_OPT_THREADSAFE) {
200 EVTHREAD_ALLOC_LOCK(lev->base.lock, EVTHREAD_LOCKTYPE_RECURSIVE);
201 }
202
203 event_assign(&lev->listener, base, fd, EV_READ|EV_PERSIST,
204 listener_read_cb, lev);
205
206 if (!(flags & LEV_OPT_DISABLED))
207 evconnlistener_enable(&lev->base);
208
209 return &lev->base;
210}
211
212struct evconnlistener *
213evconnlistener_new_bind(struct event_base *base, evconnlistener_cb cb,
214 void *ptr, unsigned flags, int backlog, const struct sockaddr *sa,
215 int socklen)
216{
217 struct evconnlistener *listener;
218 evutil_socket_t fd;
219 int on = 1;
220 int family = sa ? sa->sa_family : AF_UNSPEC;
221 int socktype = SOCK_STREAM | EVUTIL_SOCK_NONBLOCK;
222
223 if (backlog == 0)
224 return NULL;
225
226 if (flags & LEV_OPT_CLOSE_ON_EXEC)
227 socktype |= EVUTIL_SOCK_CLOEXEC;
228
229 fd = evutil_socket_(family, socktype, 0);
230 if (fd == -1)
231 return NULL;
232
233 if (setsockopt(fd, SOL_SOCKET, SO_KEEPALIVE, (void*)&on, sizeof(on))<0)
234 goto err;
235
236 if (flags & LEV_OPT_REUSEABLE) {
237 if (evutil_make_listen_socket_reuseable(fd) < 0)
238 goto err;
239 }
240
241 if (flags & LEV_OPT_REUSEABLE_PORT) {
242 if (evutil_make_listen_socket_reuseable_port(fd) < 0)
243 goto err;
244 }
245
246 if (flags & LEV_OPT_DEFERRED_ACCEPT) {
247 if (evutil_make_tcp_listen_socket_deferred(fd) < 0)
248 goto err;
249 }
250
251 if (sa) {
252 if (bind(fd, sa, socklen)<0)
253 goto err;
254 }
255
256 listener = evconnlistener_new(base, cb, ptr, flags, backlog, fd);
257 if (!listener)
258 goto err;
259
260 return listener;
261err:
262 evutil_closesocket(fd);
263 return NULL;
264}
265
266void
267evconnlistener_free(struct evconnlistener *lev)
268{
269 LOCK(lev);
270 lev->cb = NULL;
271 lev->errorcb = NULL;
272 if (lev->ops->shutdown)
273 lev->ops->shutdown(lev);
274 listener_decref_and_unlock(lev);
275}
276
277static void
278event_listener_destroy(struct evconnlistener *lev)
279{
280 struct evconnlistener_event *lev_e =
281 EVUTIL_UPCAST(lev, struct evconnlistener_event, base);
282
283 event_del(&lev_e->listener);
284 if (lev->flags & LEV_OPT_CLOSE_ON_FREE)
285 evutil_closesocket(event_get_fd(&lev_e->listener));
286 event_debug_unassign(&lev_e->listener);
287}
288
289int
290evconnlistener_enable(struct evconnlistener *lev)
291{
292 int r;
293 LOCK(lev);
294 lev->enabled = 1;
295 if (lev->cb)
296 r = lev->ops->enable(lev);
297 else
298 r = 0;
299 UNLOCK(lev);
300 return r;
301}
302
303int
304evconnlistener_disable(struct evconnlistener *lev)
305{
306 int r;
307 LOCK(lev);
308 lev->enabled = 0;
309 r = lev->ops->disable(lev);
310 UNLOCK(lev);
311 return r;
312}
313
314static int
315event_listener_enable(struct evconnlistener *lev)
316{
317 struct evconnlistener_event *lev_e =
318 EVUTIL_UPCAST(lev, struct evconnlistener_event, base);
319 return event_add(&lev_e->listener, NULL);
320}
321
322static int
323event_listener_disable(struct evconnlistener *lev)
324{
325 struct evconnlistener_event *lev_e =
326 EVUTIL_UPCAST(lev, struct evconnlistener_event, base);
327 return event_del(&lev_e->listener);
328}
329
330evutil_socket_t
331evconnlistener_get_fd(struct evconnlistener *lev)
332{
333 evutil_socket_t fd;
334 LOCK(lev);
335 fd = lev->ops->getfd(lev);
336 UNLOCK(lev);
337 return fd;
338}
339
340static evutil_socket_t
341event_listener_getfd(struct evconnlistener *lev)
342{
343 struct evconnlistener_event *lev_e =
344 EVUTIL_UPCAST(lev, struct evconnlistener_event, base);
345 return event_get_fd(&lev_e->listener);
346}
347
348struct event_base *
349evconnlistener_get_base(struct evconnlistener *lev)
350{
351 struct event_base *base;
352 LOCK(lev);
353 base = lev->ops->getbase(lev);
354 UNLOCK(lev);
355 return base;
356}
357
358static struct event_base *
359event_listener_getbase(struct evconnlistener *lev)
360{
361 struct evconnlistener_event *lev_e =
362 EVUTIL_UPCAST(lev, struct evconnlistener_event, base);
363 return event_get_base(&lev_e->listener);
364}
365
366void
367evconnlistener_set_cb(struct evconnlistener *lev,
368 evconnlistener_cb cb, void *arg)
369{
370 int enable = 0;
371 LOCK(lev);
372 if (lev->enabled && !lev->cb)
373 enable = 1;
374 lev->cb = cb;
375 lev->user_data = arg;
376 if (enable)
377 evconnlistener_enable(lev);
378 UNLOCK(lev);
379}
380
381void
382evconnlistener_set_error_cb(struct evconnlistener *lev,
383 evconnlistener_errorcb errorcb)
384{
385 LOCK(lev);
386 lev->errorcb = errorcb;
387 UNLOCK(lev);
388}
389
390static void
391listener_read_cb(evutil_socket_t fd, short what, void *p)
392{
393 struct evconnlistener *lev = p;
394 int err;
395 evconnlistener_cb cb;
396 evconnlistener_errorcb errorcb;
397 void *user_data;
398 LOCK(lev);
399 while (1) {
400 struct sockaddr_storage ss;
401 ev_socklen_t socklen = sizeof(ss);
402 evutil_socket_t new_fd = evutil_accept4_(fd, (struct sockaddr*)&ss, &socklen, lev->accept4_flags);
403 if (new_fd < 0)
404 break;
405 if (socklen == 0) {
406 /* This can happen with some older linux kernels in
407 * response to nmap. */
408 evutil_closesocket(new_fd);
409 continue;
410 }
411
412 if (lev->cb == NULL) {
413 evutil_closesocket(new_fd);
414 UNLOCK(lev);
415 return;
416 }
417 ++lev->refcnt;
418 cb = lev->cb;
419 user_data = lev->user_data;
420 UNLOCK(lev);
421 cb(lev, new_fd, (struct sockaddr*)&ss, (int)socklen,
422 user_data);
423 LOCK(lev);
424 if (lev->refcnt == 1) {
425 int freed = listener_decref_and_unlock(lev);
426 EVUTIL_ASSERT(freed);
427
428 evutil_closesocket(new_fd);
429 return;
430 }
431 --lev->refcnt;
432 }
433 err = evutil_socket_geterror(fd);
434 if (EVUTIL_ERR_ACCEPT_RETRIABLE(err)) {
435 UNLOCK(lev);
436 return;
437 }
438 if (lev->errorcb != NULL) {
439 ++lev->refcnt;
440 errorcb = lev->errorcb;
441 user_data = lev->user_data;
442 UNLOCK(lev);
443 errorcb(lev, user_data);
444 LOCK(lev);
445 listener_decref_and_unlock(lev);
446 } else {
447 event_sock_warn(fd, "Error from accept() call");
448 UNLOCK(lev);
449 }
450}
451
452#ifdef _WIN32
453struct accepting_socket {
454 CRITICAL_SECTION lock;
455 struct event_overlapped overlapped;
456 SOCKET s;
457 int error;
458 struct event_callback deferred;
459 struct evconnlistener_iocp *lev;
460 ev_uint8_t buflen;
461 ev_uint8_t family;
462 unsigned free_on_cb:1;
463 char addrbuf[1];
464};
465
466static void accepted_socket_cb(struct event_overlapped *o, ev_uintptr_t key,
467 ev_ssize_t n, int ok);
468static void accepted_socket_invoke_user_cb(struct event_callback *cb, void *arg);
469
470static void
471iocp_listener_event_add(struct evconnlistener_iocp *lev)
472{
473 if (lev->event_added)
474 return;
475
476 lev->event_added = 1;
477 event_base_add_virtual_(lev->event_base);
478}
479
480static void
481iocp_listener_event_del(struct evconnlistener_iocp *lev)
482{
483 if (!lev->event_added)
484 return;
485
486 lev->event_added = 0;
487 event_base_del_virtual_(lev->event_base);
488}
489
490static struct accepting_socket *
491new_accepting_socket(struct evconnlistener_iocp *lev, int family)
492{
493 struct accepting_socket *res;
494 int addrlen;
495 int buflen;
496
497 if (family == AF_INET)
498 addrlen = sizeof(struct sockaddr_in);
499 else if (family == AF_INET6)
500 addrlen = sizeof(struct sockaddr_in6);
501 else
502 return NULL;
503 buflen = (addrlen+16)*2;
504
505 res = mm_calloc(1,sizeof(struct accepting_socket)-1+buflen);
506 if (!res)
507 return NULL;
508
509 event_overlapped_init_(&res->overlapped, accepted_socket_cb);
510 res->s = INVALID_SOCKET;
511 res->lev = lev;
512 res->buflen = buflen;
513 res->family = family;
514
515 event_deferred_cb_init_(&res->deferred,
516 event_base_get_npriorities(lev->event_base) / 2,
517 accepted_socket_invoke_user_cb, res);
518
519 InitializeCriticalSectionAndSpinCount(&res->lock, 1000);
520
521 return res;
522}
523
524static void
525free_and_unlock_accepting_socket(struct accepting_socket *as)
526{
527 /* requires lock. */
528 if (as->s != INVALID_SOCKET)
529 closesocket(as->s);
530
531 LeaveCriticalSection(&as->lock);
532 DeleteCriticalSection(&as->lock);
533 mm_free(as);
534}
535
536static int
537start_accepting(struct accepting_socket *as)
538{
539 /* requires lock */
540 const struct win32_extension_fns *ext = event_get_win32_extension_fns_();
541 DWORD pending = 0;
542 SOCKET s = socket(as->family, SOCK_STREAM, 0);
543 int error = 0;
544
545 if (!as->lev->base.enabled)
546 return 0;
547
548 if (s == INVALID_SOCKET) {
549 error = WSAGetLastError();
550 goto report_err;
551 }
552
553 /* XXXX It turns out we need to do this again later. Does this call
554 * have any effect? */
555 setsockopt(s, SOL_SOCKET, SO_UPDATE_ACCEPT_CONTEXT,
556 (char *)&as->lev->fd, sizeof(&as->lev->fd));
557
558 if (!(as->lev->base.flags & LEV_OPT_LEAVE_SOCKETS_BLOCKING))
559 evutil_make_socket_nonblocking(s);
560
561 if (event_iocp_port_associate_(as->lev->port, s, 1) < 0) {
562 closesocket(s);
563 return -1;
564 }
565
566 as->s = s;
567
568 if (ext->AcceptEx(as->lev->fd, s, as->addrbuf, 0,
569 as->buflen/2, as->buflen/2, &pending, &as->overlapped.overlapped))
570 {
571 /* Immediate success! */
572 accepted_socket_cb(&as->overlapped, 1, 0, 1);
573 } else {
574 error = WSAGetLastError();
575 if (error != ERROR_IO_PENDING) {
576 goto report_err;
577 }
578 }
579
580 return 0;
581
582report_err:
583 as->error = error;
584 event_deferred_cb_schedule_(
585 as->lev->event_base,
586 &as->deferred);
587 return 0;
588}
589
590static void
591stop_accepting(struct accepting_socket *as)
592{
593 /* requires lock. */
594 SOCKET s = as->s;
595 as->s = INVALID_SOCKET;
596 closesocket(s);
597}
598
599static void
600accepted_socket_invoke_user_cb(struct event_callback *dcb, void *arg)
601{
602 struct accepting_socket *as = arg;
603
604 struct sockaddr *sa_local=NULL, *sa_remote=NULL;
605 int socklen_local=0, socklen_remote=0;
606 const struct win32_extension_fns *ext = event_get_win32_extension_fns_();
607 struct evconnlistener *lev = &as->lev->base;
608 evutil_socket_t sock=-1;
609 void *data;
610 evconnlistener_cb cb=NULL;
611 evconnlistener_errorcb errorcb=NULL;
612 int error;
613
614 EVUTIL_ASSERT(ext->GetAcceptExSockaddrs);
615
616 LOCK(lev);
617 EnterCriticalSection(&as->lock);
618 if (as->free_on_cb) {
619 free_and_unlock_accepting_socket(as);
620 listener_decref_and_unlock(lev);
621 return;
622 }
623
624 ++lev->refcnt;
625
626 error = as->error;
627 if (error) {
628 as->error = 0;
629 errorcb = lev->errorcb;
630 } else {
631 ext->GetAcceptExSockaddrs(
632 as->addrbuf, 0, as->buflen/2, as->buflen/2,
633 &sa_local, &socklen_local, &sa_remote,
634 &socklen_remote);
635 sock = as->s;
636 cb = lev->cb;
637 as->s = INVALID_SOCKET;
638
639 /* We need to call this so getsockname, getpeername, and
640 * shutdown work correctly on the accepted socket. */
641 /* XXXX handle error? */
642 setsockopt(sock, SOL_SOCKET, SO_UPDATE_ACCEPT_CONTEXT,
643 (char *)&as->lev->fd, sizeof(&as->lev->fd));
644 }
645 data = lev->user_data;
646
647 LeaveCriticalSection(&as->lock);
648 UNLOCK(lev);
649
650 if (errorcb) {
651 WSASetLastError(error);
652 errorcb(lev, data);
653 } else if (cb) {
654 cb(lev, sock, sa_remote, socklen_remote, data);
655 }
656
657 LOCK(lev);
658 if (listener_decref_and_unlock(lev))
659 return;
660
661 EnterCriticalSection(&as->lock);
662 start_accepting(as);
663 LeaveCriticalSection(&as->lock);
664}
665
666static void
667accepted_socket_cb(struct event_overlapped *o, ev_uintptr_t key, ev_ssize_t n, int ok)
668{
669 struct accepting_socket *as =
670 EVUTIL_UPCAST(o, struct accepting_socket, overlapped);
671
672 LOCK(&as->lev->base);
673 EnterCriticalSection(&as->lock);
674 if (ok) {
675 /* XXXX Don't do this if some EV_MT flag is set. */
676 event_deferred_cb_schedule_(
677 as->lev->event_base,
678 &as->deferred);
679 LeaveCriticalSection(&as->lock);
680 } else if (as->free_on_cb) {
681 struct evconnlistener *lev = &as->lev->base;
682 free_and_unlock_accepting_socket(as);
683 listener_decref_and_unlock(lev);
684 return;
685 } else if (as->s == INVALID_SOCKET) {
686 /* This is okay; we were disabled by iocp_listener_disable. */
687 LeaveCriticalSection(&as->lock);
688 } else {
689 /* Some error on accept that we couldn't actually handle. */
690 BOOL ok;
691 DWORD transfer = 0, flags=0;
692 event_sock_warn(as->s, "Unexpected error on AcceptEx");
693 ok = WSAGetOverlappedResult(as->s, &o->overlapped,
694 &transfer, FALSE, &flags);
695 if (ok) {
696 /* well, that was confusing! */
697 as->error = 1;
698 } else {
699 as->error = WSAGetLastError();
700 }
701 event_deferred_cb_schedule_(
702 as->lev->event_base,
703 &as->deferred);
704 LeaveCriticalSection(&as->lock);
705 }
706 UNLOCK(&as->lev->base);
707}
708
709static int
710iocp_listener_enable(struct evconnlistener *lev)
711{
712 int i;
713 struct evconnlistener_iocp *lev_iocp =
714 EVUTIL_UPCAST(lev, struct evconnlistener_iocp, base);
715
716 LOCK(lev);
717 iocp_listener_event_add(lev_iocp);
718 for (i = 0; i < lev_iocp->n_accepting; ++i) {
719 struct accepting_socket *as = lev_iocp->accepting[i];
720 if (!as)
721 continue;
722 EnterCriticalSection(&as->lock);
723 if (!as->free_on_cb && as->s == INVALID_SOCKET)
724 start_accepting(as);
725 LeaveCriticalSection(&as->lock);
726 }
727 UNLOCK(lev);
728 return 0;
729}
730
731static int
732iocp_listener_disable_impl(struct evconnlistener *lev, int shutdown)
733{
734 int i;
735 struct evconnlistener_iocp *lev_iocp =
736 EVUTIL_UPCAST(lev, struct evconnlistener_iocp, base);
737
738 LOCK(lev);
739 iocp_listener_event_del(lev_iocp);
740 for (i = 0; i < lev_iocp->n_accepting; ++i) {
741 struct accepting_socket *as = lev_iocp->accepting[i];
742 if (!as)
743 continue;
744 EnterCriticalSection(&as->lock);
745 if (!as->free_on_cb && as->s != INVALID_SOCKET) {
746 if (shutdown)
747 as->free_on_cb = 1;
748 stop_accepting(as);
749 }
750 LeaveCriticalSection(&as->lock);
751 }
752
753 if (shutdown && lev->flags & LEV_OPT_CLOSE_ON_FREE)
754 evutil_closesocket(lev_iocp->fd);
755
756 UNLOCK(lev);
757 return 0;
758}
759
760static int
761iocp_listener_disable(struct evconnlistener *lev)
762{
763 return iocp_listener_disable_impl(lev,0);
764}
765
766static void
767iocp_listener_destroy(struct evconnlistener *lev)
768{
769 struct evconnlistener_iocp *lev_iocp =
770 EVUTIL_UPCAST(lev, struct evconnlistener_iocp, base);
771
772 if (! lev_iocp->shutting_down) {
773 lev_iocp->shutting_down = 1;
774 iocp_listener_disable_impl(lev,1);
775 }
776
777}
778
779static evutil_socket_t
780iocp_listener_getfd(struct evconnlistener *lev)
781{
782 struct evconnlistener_iocp *lev_iocp =
783 EVUTIL_UPCAST(lev, struct evconnlistener_iocp, base);
784 return lev_iocp->fd;
785}
786static struct event_base *
787iocp_listener_getbase(struct evconnlistener *lev)
788{
789 struct evconnlistener_iocp *lev_iocp =
790 EVUTIL_UPCAST(lev, struct evconnlistener_iocp, base);
791 return lev_iocp->event_base;
792}
793
794static const struct evconnlistener_ops evconnlistener_iocp_ops = {
795 iocp_listener_enable,
796 iocp_listener_disable,
797 iocp_listener_destroy,
798 iocp_listener_destroy, /* shutdown */
799 iocp_listener_getfd,
800 iocp_listener_getbase
801};
802
803/* XXX define some way to override this. */
804#define N_SOCKETS_PER_LISTENER 4
805
806struct evconnlistener *
807evconnlistener_new_async(struct event_base *base,
808 evconnlistener_cb cb, void *ptr, unsigned flags, int backlog,
809 evutil_socket_t fd)
810{
811 struct sockaddr_storage ss;
812 int socklen = sizeof(ss);
813 struct evconnlistener_iocp *lev;
814 int i;
815
816 flags |= LEV_OPT_THREADSAFE;
817
818 if (!base || !event_base_get_iocp_(base))
819 goto err;
820
821 /* XXXX duplicate code */
822 if (backlog > 0) {
823 if (listen(fd, backlog) < 0)
824 goto err;
825 } else if (backlog < 0) {
826 if (listen(fd, 128) < 0)
827 goto err;
828 }
829 if (getsockname(fd, (struct sockaddr*)&ss, &socklen)) {
830 event_sock_warn(fd, "getsockname");
831 goto err;
832 }
833 lev = mm_calloc(1, sizeof(struct evconnlistener_iocp));
834 if (!lev) {
835 event_warn("calloc");
836 goto err;
837 }
838 lev->base.ops = &evconnlistener_iocp_ops;
839 lev->base.cb = cb;
840 lev->base.user_data = ptr;
841 lev->base.flags = flags;
842 lev->base.refcnt = 1;
843 lev->base.enabled = 1;
844
845 lev->port = event_base_get_iocp_(base);
846 lev->fd = fd;
847 lev->event_base = base;
848
849
850 if (event_iocp_port_associate_(lev->port, fd, 1) < 0)
851 goto err_free_lev;
852
853 EVTHREAD_ALLOC_LOCK(lev->base.lock, EVTHREAD_LOCKTYPE_RECURSIVE);
854
855 lev->n_accepting = N_SOCKETS_PER_LISTENER;
856 lev->accepting = mm_calloc(lev->n_accepting,
857 sizeof(struct accepting_socket *));
858 if (!lev->accepting) {
859 event_warn("calloc");
860 goto err_delete_lock;
861 }
862 for (i = 0; i < lev->n_accepting; ++i) {
863 lev->accepting[i] = new_accepting_socket(lev, ss.ss_family);
864 if (!lev->accepting[i]) {
865 event_warnx("Couldn't create accepting socket");
866 goto err_free_accepting;
867 }
868 if (cb && start_accepting(lev->accepting[i]) < 0) {
869 event_warnx("Couldn't start accepting on socket");
870 EnterCriticalSection(&lev->accepting[i]->lock);
871 free_and_unlock_accepting_socket(lev->accepting[i]);
872 goto err_free_accepting;
873 }
874 ++lev->base.refcnt;
875 }
876
877 iocp_listener_event_add(lev);
878
879 return &lev->base;
880
881err_free_accepting:
882 mm_free(lev->accepting);
883 /* XXXX free the other elements. */
884err_delete_lock:
885 EVTHREAD_FREE_LOCK(lev->base.lock, EVTHREAD_LOCKTYPE_RECURSIVE);
886err_free_lev:
887 mm_free(lev);
888err:
889 /* Don't close the fd, it is caller's responsibility. */
890 return NULL;
891}
892
893#endif
